title: Project Creation Success
description: Verify that a user can successfully create a new project with valid name and description via the UI and is redirected to the project dashboard.

title: Project Creation Input Validation
description: Verify that project creation form validates inputs and provides user feedback for invalid or missing data.

title: Discovery Q&A Completion Workflow
description: Verify that the discovery Q&A process via the Lead Agent on the dashboard completes successfully and produces a valid PRD.

title: PRD Viewer Rendering
description: Verify that the generated Product Requirements Document (PRD) is correctly rendered in markdown format within the PRD modal viewer.

title: Hierarchical Task Management Display and Interaction
description: Verify that issues and nested tasks are displayed correctly in the task tree with collapsible views and status badges.

title: Multi-Agent Concurrent Execution and Status Updates
description: Verify that multiple agents execute assigned tasks concurrently respecting dependencies and real-time status updates are reflected on the dashboard.

title: Human-in-the-Loop Blocker Creation and Resolution
description: Verify creation, display, filtering, sorting, and resolution of human-in-the-loop blockers with correct synchronization across backend, agents, and UI.

title: Session Lifecycle Management - Save and Resume
description: Verify that current session state including project progress, blockers, and active agents is saved, persisted, and can be resumed accurately with correct progress visualization.

title: Quality Gates Enforcement Before Task Completion
description: Verify that tasks cannot be marked complete by agents unless all related tests, linting, and code review quality gates have passed.

title: Code Review Panel Updates on WebSocket Events
description: Verify that the code review panel auto-updates including score visualizations and findings lists upon receiving relevant WebSocket events (approval, changes requested, rejection).

title: Lint Quality Trend Chart Auto-Refresh and Visualization
description: Verify that lint quality trend charts display accurate error/warning counts over time and auto-refresh every 30 seconds with the latest data.

title: Real-Time Chat Interface with Lead Agent
description: Verify that the real-time chat interface with typing indicators, markdown support, and message history functions correctly with WebSocket integration.

title: API Client Endpoint Response and Type Safety
description: Verify that all typed API client endpoints respond correctly within performance thresholds and maintain expected type-safe contracts.

title: Robust Context Memory Management and Visualization
description: Verify tiered (HOT/WARM/COLD) context memory visualization updates automatically with accurate token usage and supports filtering and pagination.

title: WebSocket Client Connection Management and Message Handling
description: Verify that the WebSocket client maintains connection with exponential backoff reconnection strategy and correctly processes all supported message types including conflict resolution.

title: User Input Validation on Blocker Resolution Modal
description: Verify that blocker resolution modal input fields validate user input and show clear feedback preventing invalid submissions.

title: Dashboard Real-Time Status Update Consistency
description: Verify that the dashboard overview, agent cards, task tree, blockers panel, review results, lint trends, and session status update consistently and real-time with WebSocket events.

title: API and UI Robustness Against Session File Corruption
description: Verify that corrupted session files or invalid session data do not cause application crashes and that recovery or graceful error handling occurs.

title: Agent Management UI Navigation and Info Accuracy
description: Verify agent cards display accurate info and clicking navigates to detailed context memory views correctly.

title: Documentation and Type Definitions Synchronization
description: Verify that the TypeScript type definitions align with the API and UI implementations ensuring type safety and preventing drift.
